40158660BE0741A8A284BD1A4EB7F271.description: perform a query-by-example from given search criteria.

8F0527FF2A0D49DBB1714E9EBC2C4036.description: define a single-table database from given data storage requirements

5FA0F27DCFBA4D4FBA8AF4369DBFC6BC.description: understand and use the concepts of sequence, selection, repetition, totalling and counting

E6A7E097D3504F8B92422571D82CA743.description: declare and use variables and constants

understand and use standard flowchart symbols to represent the above statements, commands
and structures

3E63E7FE72FE4895B5404669E5E7A0E8.description:
understand and use pseudocode, using the following commands and statements:
INPUT and OUTPUT (e.g. READ and PRINT)
totalling (e.g. Sum ← Sum + Number)
counting (e.g. Count ← Count + 1)

D955BBC1C32246BA920D8266FDE55B26.description:
understand and use pseudocode, using the following loop structures:
FOR … TO … NEXT
REPEAT … UNTIL
WHILE … DO … ENDWHILE

understand and use pseudocode, using the following conditional statements:
IF … THEN … ELSE … ENDIF
CASE … OF … OTHERWISE … ENDCASE

CF442DFC536F48F4AA6A0041CC072EB5.description: comment on the effectiveness of a given solution

28AAF1B6F2304420A7195BF1B85B29A8.description:
understand the need for validation and verification checks to be made on input data (validation

DBBC3D249CA043AA9F1E2CF684EBE4E5.description:
show understanding that every computer system is made up of sub-systems, which in turn are
made up of further sub-systems

48BAD0EF9E6A4349830A9FDE0314BA8C.description:
show understanding of the ethical issues raised by the spread of electronic communication and
computer systems, including hacking, cracking and production of malware

5C898D65C41442EDA795F7FE90C5BFAD.description: distinguish between free software, freeware and shareware

C32C8A234DD2442FA8EFDFFD4331F3D5.description: show understanding of computer ethics, including copyright issues and plagiarism

110A7AB814914EB796C462D5648DD48F.description: Describe the above and relate to real life scenarios

6F0B38A081D749BFB236E44A31F4B9CA.description:
show understanding of the need to keep online systems safe from attacks including denial of
service attacks, phishing, pharming

6A1173334131462B8D2C1BE4CAEB9743.description:
show understanding of how data are kept safe when stored and transmitted, including:
– use of passwords, both entered at a keyboard and biometric
– use of firewalls, both software and hardware, including proxy servers
– use of security protocols such as Secure Socket Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security
(TLS)
– use of symmetric encryption (plain text, cypher text and use of a key) showing
understanding that increasing the length of a key increases the strength of the encryption

33607C4DCBDE4CFC9EEFF73E8B3CC7FE.description:
show understanding of the need to keep data safe from malicious actions, including
unauthorised viewing, deleting, copying and corruption

D2AE9B1CE82F4CCAA8425659625EE67F.description:
show understanding of the need to keep data safe from accidental damage, including
corruption and human errors

28DEFE19ACF14BB0A62321F9469F25E2.description:
show understanding of the need for assemblers when translating programs written in assembly
language

BE41AF1BFFC94E77A28609C7492B05A0.description: show understanding of the use of interpreters with high-level language programs

0DA95DB889FE453CBD75FA41D8901318.description:
show understanding of the need for compilers when translating programs written in a high-level
language

947C74A6EAF449A2A09CD01D08378BE7.description: show understanding of the need for both high-level and low-level languages

617EE7618F05493F941F59636A6BB89D.description: High- and low-level languages and their translators

AD59C95AD09A4EAF930A6E7FB613966A.description: show understanding of the need for interrupts

379395A3C04140C989BBE0D16AA2E5D4.description:
describe the purpose of an operating system (Candidates will be required to understand the
purpose and function of an operating system and why it is needed. They will not be required to
understand how operating systems work.)

BE5A86F0C14F4558B808DF59490DA4B6.description: calculate the storage requirement of a file

3F79E9CC5D1D43C489AE6605EF75B81F.description:
describe how these principles are applied to currently available storage solutions, such as
SSDs, HDDs, USB flash memory, DVDs, CDs and Blu-ray discs

DFA2894F15CB4809BD3402FB6D781D44.description:
describe the principles of operation of a range of types of storage device and media including
magnetic, optical and solid state

664DA597AD804036BD893AF98DD393FF.description:
show understanding of the difference between: primary, secondary and off-line storage and
provide examples of each, such as:
primary: Read Only Memory (ROM), and Random Access Memory (RAM)
secondary: hard disk drive (HDD) and Solid State Drive (SSD); off-line: Digital Versatile Disc
(DVD), Compact Disc (CD), Blu-ray disc, USB flash memory and removable HDD

2C0062820C3D47188A9481A4FCDB7AB7.description:
describe how these principles are applied to real-life scenarios, for example: printing single
items on demand or in large volumes; use of small screens on mobile devices

7AD61619645E4E718AD351EABF542427.description:
describe the principles of operation of the following output devices: inkjet, laser and 3D
printers; 2D and 3D cutters; speakers and headphones; actuators; flat-panel display screens,
such as Liquid Crystal Display (LCD) and Light-Emitting Diodes (LED) display; LCD projectors
and Digital Light Projectors (DLP)

F7EB4F715C3A43A59B112B00693AB1C3.description:
describe how these sensors are used in real-life scenarios, for example: street lights, security
devices, pollution control, games, and household and industrial applications

866B6C171BE44669A5F80EB3ABDDBFFB.description:
describe how a range of sensors can be used to input data into a computer system, including
light, temperature, magnetic field, gas, pressure, moisture, humidity, pH and motion

0F7E6DB55E204924A5D98D86C99172DF.description:
describe how these principles are applied to real-life scenarios, for example: scanning of
passports at airports, barcode readers at supermarket checkouts, and touch screens on mobile
devices

5E364B49571641679CA1541C4D74FA78.description:
describe the principles of operation (how each device works) of these input devices: 2D and
3D scanners, barcode readers, Quick Response (QR) code readers, digital cameras, keyboards,
mice, touch screens, interactive whiteboards, microphones

5F25551BF6984CAD8CC3CDE14E2BEEA0.description: describe the stages of the fetch-execute cycle, including the use of registers and buses

847B6806F6CB43A5894064203D3A1135.description:
show understanding of the basic Von Neumann model for a computer system and the stored
program concept (program instructions and data are stored in main memory and instructions
are fetched and executed one after another)

2CBF9B5B0E794996BFC8DED51A0DAE74.description: Computer architecture and the fetch-execute cycle

5DE50658025A4446A88F25536173B44A.description: show understanding of the role of the browser

explain how anti-virus and other protection software helps to protect the user from security

show understanding of the Internet risks associated with malware, including viruses, spyware

E65C006C43084414845EF0894BED3FCF.description:
show understanding of the security aspects of using the Internet and understand what
methods are available to help minimise the risks

5D38E3AA5B1B4606AD77C1846D9285DE.description:
show understanding of the use of serial and parallel data transmission, in Universal Serial Bus
(USB) and Integrated Circuit (IC

3C3DB91DEC49446BA5A969F82E36B07C.description: show understanding of the need to check for errors

1A6B8D428960425799AFF6377D033F44.description: distinguish between simplex, duplex and half-duplex data transmission

show understanding of the principles of data compression (lossless and lossy) applied to music/
video, photos and text files

88786BD077D54691975E3F5883F0D27D.description:
show understanding of the concept of Musical Instrument Digital Interface (MIDI) files, JPEG
files, MP3 and MP4 files

identify and describe methods of error detection and correction, such as parity checks, check
digits, checksums and Automatic Repeat reQuests (ARQ)

676FA1AF937B4E2BBB8B9CCC32C674B3.description:
show understanding that sound (music), pictures, video, text and numbers are stored in
different formats

Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Media Access Control (MAC) addresses, assembly
languages and machine code, debugging

97453B691F5C4BE999CF936E0DA940CE.description:
convert positive hexadecimal integers to and from binary (a maximum of 16 bit binary numbers
will be required)

DDE1E42EA2D546EFB3DD1BA701AC86C2.description:
convert positive hexadecimal integers to and from denary (a maximum of four hexadecimal
digits will be required)

use binary in computer registers for a given application (such as in robotics, digital instruments

show understanding of the concept of a byte and how the byte is used to measure memory

3B7754127596434C903908042DC43CF5.description:
convert positive denary integers into binary and positive binary integers into denary (a
maximum of 16 bits will be used)

F025FD91CB3346A4860D46788084CB6D.description: recognise the use of binary numbers in computer systems
